courseDetails.title: Pomodoro Technique for Effective Developers and Programmers
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master the Pomodoro Technique to Boost Your Productivity and Efficiency as a Programmer or Software Developer
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to the Pomodoro Technique for Efficient Programmers and Developers Course!

As a programmer or developer, you know that time is of the essence. You have deadlines to meet, projects to complete, and clients to satisfy. It's no secret that being productive and efficient with your time is key to achieving success in this field.

That's where the Pomodoro Technique comes in. This time management method was created in the late 1980s by Francesco Cirillo and has since become a popular tool for maximizing productivity and efficiency.

The Pomodoro Technique is based on the idea of breaking your workday into focused, 25-minute intervals called "Pomodoros," followed by short breaks. This system helps you stay focused and avoid distractions, while also ensuring that you take regular breaks to prevent burnout.

In this course, you'll learn how to use the Pomodoro Technique to become a more efficient programmer or developer. You'll discover how to set goals and prioritize tasks, how to stay focused and avoid distractions, and how to manage your time effectively.

Through a series of interactive lessons, you'll learn the key principles of the Pomodoro Technique and how to apply them to your workday. You'll also have access to a range of resources and tools to help you track your progress and stay motivated.

By the end of this course, you'll have the skills and knowledge you need to become a more productive and efficient programmer or developer. So why wait? Sign up today and start mastering the Pomodoro Technique!
targetAudiences: Busy professionals : If you juggle multiple projects and responsibilities, this course is perfect for you.
Procrastinators : to help you overcome this habit and become more productive
Students: If you need to balance coursework with other commitments, the Pomodoro Technique can be a game-changer.

courseDetails.title: Web5 Fundamentals - A New Evolution of Web & Data Ownership
courseDetails.shortDescription: The 'Extra' decentralized web that puts you in control of your Data and Identity
courseDetails.longDescription:
WEB5: AN EXTRA DECENTRALIZED WEB PLATFORM

The web democratized the exchange of information, but it's missing a key layer: identity. We struggle to secure personal data with hundreds of accounts and passwords we can’t remember. On the web today, identity and personal data have become the property of third parties.


Web5 brings decentralized identity and data storage to your applications. It lets devs focus on creating delightful user experiences, while returning ownership of data and identity to individuals.


Just when we were beginning to get a hand on Web3 and its attempts to popularize crypto-related projects, Block Head Jack Dorsey announced plans to build a new decentralized web centered around Bitcoin (BTC), & this largest blockchain network will play a major role in the internet’s evolution. The new project, called “Web5,”  is part of Square’s TBD subsidiary, which is working on a suite of BTC-based solutions to help revolutionize the financial system. It will be the next step in the internet’s evolution, with the goal of removing third-party control over its customers’ data.


In this course we will :

  • Recap about Web1, Web2 & Web3 & how is Web5 different

  • Understand Web5 in detail

  • Get to know Web5's pillars and components

  • See Web5's use cases

  • Great collection of resources to read more about Web5

A Verifiable Certificate of Completion is presented to all students who undertake this Web5 course.

courseDetails.title: PyScript Fundamentals 101- Run Python in your Browser's HTML
courseDetails.shortDescription: Now write your Python Code Snippets directly in HTML - Taking Web Development to a whole new Level !
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you a data scientist or a developer who mostly uses Python? Are you jealous of developers who write Javascript code and build fancy websites in a browser? How nice would it be if we could write websites in Python?


Python has grown in popularity immensely in recent years. It has a wide range of applications, from its most popular use in Artificial Intelligence, to Data Science, Robotics, and Scripting. But In the web development field, Python is used mainly on the backend with frameworks such as Django and Flask.


Before now, Python didn't have much support on the front-end side like other languages such as JavaScript. But thankfully, this year, during the PyCon 2022 conference, Peter Wang (CEO of Anaconda) announced a framework named PyScript that allows you to use Python on the web using standard HTML.

So, The only missing piece to make Python a universal programming language is here !


Think of PyScript as the “Minecraft of software development”: Users crafting their own worlds (applications) or new blocks and mods (components and widgets), and sharing them with the world.

This is the exciting beginning for supporting new ways of programming, building, sharing, and deploying applications. PyScript is a game changer and in this course we will learn everything about this awesome new tech skill - the basics, the setup, and coding in PyScript.

courseDetails.title: Emotional Intelligence for Software Engineers and Developers
courseDetails.shortDescription: Improve your Emotional Intelligence & Boost your career growth using Success@Work model with effective Practical Tips !
courseDetails.longDescription:
As software developers, we have our image of what it means to be a good developer, and we also have a mental model of the road we started walking when we first entered the field as interns or as junior developers. Most of the time, we research what technical books to read, what courses to watch, which field to go into, web development, mobile development, or something else. The Technology, the tool - we get so involved in this wide array of choices, and so there is something very foundational that we might miss if we don’t pay enough attention and get lost in the technicality.


There is a set of skills known as “soft” skills, and that forms the 'EI' or 'Emotional Intelligence'.


Emotional intelligence is something everyone has, but which few of us really know how to channel or develop. Many Software Developers wrongly believe it to be a quality they simply don’t possess – and that if they weren’t born with it, it’s something there’s no hope of attaining later in life. But the good news for all of us is that emotional intelligence in general, and empathy in particular, are things we can train ourselves to have more of.


More and more employers are looking for coders and Software Developers who have the right set of “soft skills”, such as the ability to work well with a team, to empathize with coworkers and customers, and to de-escalate emotional situations. All of these skills require a high degree of emotional intelligence. What is emotional intelligence, and why is it important? And how can software engineers, coders and programmers develop emotional intelligence before or during their career? You’ll learn the answers to those questions in this course.


I assure you that after taking this course you'll say :


  • I’ve come to understand why I previously avoided certain situations, the roots this had in particular emotions, and the impact all that had on my sense of self-worth. 

  • Getting an insight into what people around me want, and why they do what they do, has become dramatically easier for me.

  • Because I can now understand them better, knowing how other people are probably going to act has become much easier.

  • I’ve begun to find it much simpler to identify and engage in the small pleasures that brighten up my life and make me more productive. 

  • Difficult tasks like engaging in negotiation have come to be things I can take pleasure in.

  • My Development efficiency has increased well, and I am now able to respond well to negative situations like downtime, outages etc.


Top Reasons why you should choose this Course :


  • This course is designed keeping in mind the students from all backgrounds - hence we cover everything from basics like EI fundamentals, and gradually progress towards more important topics around EI, seeing some practical tips to improve.

courseDetails.title: Essentiels du COO: Dominez l’Opérationnel [FR]
courseDetails.shortDescription: Compétences de COO : stratégie, optimisation, finance et leadership pour l’excellence opérationnelle
courseDetails.longDescription:
Le Directeur des Opérations (COO) joue un rôle clé dans l’amélioration de l’efficacité opérationnelle d’une entreprise, impactant directement la rentabilité et le succès organisationnel. Ce cours en ligne complet, animé par l’expert Mike Pritula, est conçu pour équiper les futurs COOs, professionnels RH et PDGs des outils et connaissances nécessaires pour optimiser les opérations, développer des stratégies efficaces et cultiver une culture d’entreprise productive.


Ce que vous apprendrez :


• Rôle et responsabilités du COO : Comprenez en profondeur la position de COO, ses compétences clés et les outils nécessaires à sa réussite.


• Développement et mise en œuvre de stratégies : Apprenez à mener des sessions stratégiques, à utiliser des outils comme les analyses SWOT et PESTEL, et à créer des plans stratégiques clairs et cohérents.


• Gestion de la culture d’entreprise : Découvrez comment définir, intégrer et utiliser la culture d’entreprise comme levier stratégique pour atteindre vos objectifs.


• Optimisation et automatisation des processus : Maîtrisez l’art de concevoir, décrire et optimiser les processus métiers, et explorez les outils d’automatisation.


• Gestion de la structure organisationnelle : Familiarisez-vous avec différents types de structures, les principes de conception et les techniques pour optimiser les effectifs et clarifier les responsabilités.


• Gestion de projets et du changement : Développez des compétences pour sélectionner, gérer et suivre les projets, et pour introduire efficacement des changements organisationnels.


• Gestion financière : Acquérez des connaissances en gestion financière, y compris en budgétisation, prévision et optimisation des flux de trésorerie et des ventes.


Programme du cours :

1. Introduction au rôle de COO : Découvrez son importance, ses compétences requises et les outils pour une gestion opérationnelle efficace.

2. Développement stratégique : Apprenez à mener des sessions stratégiques et à élaborer des plans stratégiques complets avec des outils analytiques.

3. La culture d’entreprise comme outil stratégique : Comprenez comment définir et intégrer la culture d’entreprise dans tous les processus.

4. Mise en œuvre efficace des stratégies : Maîtrisez l’utilisation des KPIs, OKRs et des disciplines de performance pour exécuter les stratégies.

5. Conception et optimisation des processus : Apprenez à décrire, optimiser et automatiser les processus métiers pour plus d’efficacité.

6. Gestion de la structure organisationnelle : Maîtrisez la conception et la gestion des structures pour optimiser la performance.

7. Gestion de projets : Développez vos compétences en gestion de projets et en introduction du changement dans l’entreprise.

8. Gestion financière : Découvrez les bases de la gestion financière, la budgétisation et les stratégies pour améliorer la trésorerie.


Caractéristiques du cours :


• Enseignement par un expert : Apprenez avec Mike Pritula, un leader reconnu avec plus de 15 ans d’expérience en RH et gestion des opérations.


• Flexibilité : Accédez à huit leçons enregistrées à votre rythme, avec une leçon publiée par semaine.


• Application pratique : Effectuez des devoirs hebdomadaires avec des retours personnalisés pour renforcer vos apprentissages.


• Communauté interactive : Rejoignez un chat Telegram dédié pour échanger des idées et des expériences avec d’autres participants.


• Certification : Recevez un diplôme après avoir terminé le cours, valorisant vos compétences professionnelles.


Pour qui est ce cours ?


• Futurs et actuels Directeurs des Opérations souhaitant améliorer leurs compétences en gestion opérationnelle.


• Professionnels RH voulant élargir leurs fonctions et contribuer à l’efficacité de leur entreprise.


• PDGs et propriétaires d’entreprises cherchant à accroître l’efficacité opérationnelle de leur organisation.


Équipez-vous des compétences essentielles pour exceller dans la gestion opérationnelle et conduire votre organisation vers plus de rentabilité et de succès. Inscrivez-vous dès maintenant pour devenir un leader stratégique en gestion des opérations.
targetAudiences: Ce cours s'adresse aux chefs d'entreprise, aux professionnels des ressources humaines, aux PDG et aux dirigeants d'entreprise qui cherchent à améliorer l'efficacité opérationnelle et à favoriser la réussite de l'organisation.

A pitch deck is a concise and visually engaging presentation that is typically used in business settings to convey a company's or project's key information, value proposition, and investment opportunity. Pitch decks are primarily used when seeking investments, partnerships, or to secure new clients. They serve as a persuasive tool to convey the essence of your business or idea quickly and effectively. A well-crafted pitch deck can make a significant difference in the success of a business, startup, or project.

Here are the key components and the needs of usage for a pitch deck in a business context:

  1. Introduction: Start with a compelling introduction that grabs the audience's attention and provides an overview of your business or project.

  2. Problem Statement: Clearly define the problem or need that your product or service addresses. This sets the stage for why your business is relevant.

  3. Solution: Present your solution and how it addresses the identified problem. Explain how your product or service works and what makes it unique.

  4. Market Opportunity: Describe the market size and potential for your business. This includes the target audience and its demographics.

  5. Business Model: Explain how your business will generate revenue, your pricing strategy, and the sales channels you plan to use.

  6. Traction: Showcase any significant achievements, customer testimonials, or partnerships to build credibility.

  7. Competitive Analysis: Identify your competitors and explain how your business is positioned relative to them. Highlight your competitive advantages.

  8. Team: Introduce your team and their relevant experience. This builds trust and confidence in your ability to execute the business plan.

  9. Financial Projections: Present your financial forecasts, including revenue, expenses, and profitability projections. This demonstrates the potential for a return on investment.

  10. Ask: Clearly state what you are seeking from your audience, whether it's investment, partnership, or something else.


The skills related to pitching, business presenting, and business communication are important for experts and companies for several reasons:

  1. Securing Funding: Effective pitching skills are crucial when seeking investments or funding. A well-presented pitch deck can significantly increase the chances of attracting investors.

  2. Building Credibility: Strong presentation skills can help a company or individual build credibility with clients, partners, and stakeholders. A professional presentation conveys competence and confidence.

  3. Effective Communication: Business communication skills are essential for conveying ideas, plans, and strategies within a company. Clear and persuasive communication can drive team alignment and enhance productivity.

  4. Client Acquisition: In sales and client-facing roles, effective presentation and communication skills can help in acquiring new clients or customers. It can make the difference between a successful pitch and a missed opportunity.

  5. Career Advancement: For individuals, mastering these skills can lead to career advancement. Professionals who can effectively communicate their ideas and lead presentations tend to stand out and progress in their careers.

  6. Team Collaboration: Effective communication and presentation skills are essential for collaboration within teams. They help in conveying objectives, sharing updates, and ensuring everyone is on the same page.


Strong understanding of pitching, business presenting skills, and business communication skills is crucial in today's competitive business environment. These skills not only enable companies to attract investments, win clients, and build credibility but also support the career growth of individuals. A combination of these skills can lead to more successful and impactful business endeavors.

Course Description:

Product Owner Certification: Mastering the Art of Value Delivery in Scrum

Welcome to the Product Owner Certification, meticulously designed to elevate your understanding and application of the Scrum framework, specifically through the lens of a Product Owner. This assessment-driven course is tailored to affirm your expertise in Scrum practices and the nuances of the Product Owner role, as detailed in the Official Scrum Guide.




For Professionals: Enhance Your Agile Career

As a Product Owner or an individual aspiring to embrace this crucial role within Agile teams, this certification will benchmark your proficiency, enabling you to:

  • Showcase Your Expertise: Demonstrate your comprehensive grasp of the Scrum framework, making you a valuable asset in the Agile job market.

  • Guide Your Professional Journey: Identify your strengths and pinpoint areas for growth, steering your continuous learning in Agile methodologies.

  • Boost Your Career Prospects: Add a significant credential to your resume and LinkedIn profile, opening new doors to career advancement and professional recognition.

  • Establish Credibility: Earn the trust of your colleagues and employers with a certification that underscores your dedication to Agile principles and the Product Owner role.

For Organizations: Optimize Your Scrum Teams

In today's dynamic landscape of technology and product development, Agile methodologies are the bedrock of successful and timely product delivery. Adopting Scrum can fundamentally transform Agile product management, fostering enhanced collaboration and superior product outcomes. By engaging in our Product Owner Certification Assessment, your organization can reap numerous benefits:

  • Assess Team Skills: Confirm that your Product Owners and team members have a robust understanding of Scrum practices and values.

  • Boost Team Productivity: Identify Product Owners who can proficiently lead Agile teams, driving productivity and efficiency to new heights.

  • Foster a Learning Culture: Discover areas where your teams excel and where they could benefit from additional training, promoting an environment of continuous improvement.

  • Competitive Advantage: Distinguish your company in the realm of Agile product management by showcasing certified Product Owners, appealing to clients and projects that value certified expertise.


The Role of a Product Owner: Champion of Value Maximization

The Product Owner is a key player within Scrum teams, acting as the nexus between the customer, the development team, and the product itself. As a Product Owner, you are charged with:

  • Prioritizing Value Delivery Guide your team in delivering the highest value to customers by effectively managing and ordering the Product Backlog.

  • Facilitating Scrum Artifacts Collaborate with the Scrum Master and development team to ensure that Product Backlog items are well-understood, transparent, and actionable.

  • Navigating Complexity Tackle complex product challenges by fostering an environment that encourages innovation, rapid feedback, and iterative progress.

  • Mentoring and Leadership Empower your team to embrace Agile practices, promoting self-organization, and continuous growth in value delivery.


Why Choose Our Product Owner Certification Assessment?

Our assessment is thoughtfully crafted to reflect the comprehensive scope of the Scrum framework as per the Official Scrum Guide. What makes our Product Owner Certification Assessment stand out:

  • Real-World Application Our questions challenge you with scenarios that Product Owners frequently encounter, ensuring a practical understanding of the role.

  • Extensive Scope The assessment encompasses all critical aspects of the Product Owner role, from backlog management to stakeholder engagement, offering a thorough evaluation of your knowledge.

  • Immediate Insights Receive instant feedback on your performance, helping you to identify areas for further study or confirming your expertise.

  • Product Owner Certificate Successful candidates will receive a Product Owner Certificate issued by Agile Enterprise Coach, adding a tangible credential to your professional achievements.

Assessment Structure and Content

The Product Owner Certification Assessment consists of multiple-choice questions that span a wide array of topics, including but not limited to:

  • Scrum Theory and Empiricism

  • Product Owner Responsibilities and Accountabilities

  • Effective Product Backlog Management

  • Maximizing Value and ROI

  • Stakeholder Engagement and Communication

  • Understanding and Applying the Definition of Done


How to Get Certified

  1. Prepare Thoroughly: Study the Official Scrum Guide and familiarize yourself with the role of the Product Owner.

  2. Complete the Assessment: Answer the multiple-choice questions to the best of your ability.

  3. Submit Your Results: Send proof of your completed assessment to receive your Product Owner Certificate from our institution.

  4. Enhance Your Credentials: Display your certification on your CV and professional profiles to showcase your expertise.

Welcome to the Scrum Master Certification Certification Assessment, a comprehensive evaluation designed for individuals seeking to confirm their understanding and proficiency in the Scrum framework. This assessment is not a theoretical course but a practical examination that reflects real-world scenarios and applications of Scrum, as outlined in the Official Scrum Guide.



For Employees/ Individuals: Advance Your Agile Career

As an aspiring or current Advanced Scrum Master, this assessment will serve as a benchmark for your Scrum knowledge and skills, allowing you to:

  • Validate Expertise: Demonstrate your mastery of the Scrum framework and stand out in a competitive job market.

For Organisations/Scrum Teams : Elevate Your Team's Agile Capabilities

In the fast-paced world of technology and product management, Agile methodologies have become the cornerstone of successful product delivery. Implementing Scrum within your organization can revolutionize the way you manage projects, enhance team collaboration, and drive better product outcomes.   • Competitive Edge: By having certified Scrum Masters, your company can stay ahead of the curve in Agile product management, attracting clients and projects that value certified expertise.


The Role of a Scrum Master: Facilitator of Agile Excellence

The Scrum Master is a pivotal role within Scrum teams, acting as a facilitator, coach, and servant leader. As a Scrum Master, you are responsible for:

  • Ensuring Scrum Adoption: Guide your team in following Scrum practices, principles, and rules as described in the Official Scrum Guide.

  • Facilitating Scrum Events: Conduct effective Sprint Planning, Daily Scrums, Sprint Reviews, and Sprint Retrospectives to maximize collaboration and progress.

  • Impediment Removal: Address and eliminate obstacles that hinder your team's performance, ensuring a smooth path to project completion.

  • Coaching and Mentoring: Empower your team by promoting self-organization, cross-functionality, and continuous improvement in Agile practices.

Why Choose Our  Scrum Master Certification Certification Assessment?

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The assessment spans all essential Scrum topics, from roles and artifacts to events, providing a thorough evaluation of your Scrum knowledge.

Assessment Structure and Content

The Scrum Master Certification Assessment consists of a series of multiple-choice questions covering a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:

  • Scrum Theory and Principles

  • The Scrum Team: Roles and Responsibilities

  • Scrum Events: Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective

  • Scrum Artifacts: Product Backlog, Sprint Backlog, and Increment

  • Definition of Done

The Role of a Product Owner: Champion of Value Maximization

The Product Owner is a key player within Scrum teams, acting as the nexus between the customer, the development team, and the product itself. As a Product Owner, you are charged with:

courseDetails.title: Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos
courseDetails.shortDescription: Diploma Profissional em Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos pelo MTF Institute
courseDetails.longDescription:
Bem-vindo ao Curso: Diploma Profissional em Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos pelo MTF Institute


Curso ministrado pelo MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

O MTF é um instituto global de educação e investigação com sede em Lisboa, Portugal, focado na formação empresarial e profissional híbrida (presencial e online) nas áreas de: Negócios e Administração, Ciência e Tecnologia, Banca e Finanças.

O centro de I&D do MTF foca-se em atividades de investigação nas áreas de: Inteligência Artificial, Aprendizagem Automática ("Machine Learning"), Ciência de Dados, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Criptomoedas e Ativos Digitais, Metaversos, Transformação Digital, Fintech, Comércio Eletrónico, e Internet das Coisas.

O MTF é parceiro oficial da: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, membro da Câmara Portuguesa de Comércio e Indústria.

O MTF está presente em 208 países e foi escolhido por mais de 420 000 alunos.


Autora do Curso:

Alex Amoroso é uma profissional experiente com uma sólida formação académica e empresarial, especializada em metodologias de investigação, formulação de estratégias, e desenvolvimento de produtos. Doutorada pela Faculdade de Ciências Sociais e Políticas de Lisboa, Portugal, onde foi Aprovada com Distinção e Louvor pela sua investigação exemplar, Alex Amoroso traz consigo um vasto conhecimento e experiência.

Para além dos seus estudos de doutoramento, a Doutora Amoroso tem atuado como Professora Convidada, ministrando cursos a uma vasta gama de estudantes desde a licenciatura até alunos de cursos profissionais e executivos. Atualmente, na EIMT em Zurique, Suíça, leciona para doutorandos, oferecendo instrução avançada em desenho e metodologias de investigação. No Instituto MTF, a Doutora Amoroso lidera a área académica de Desenvolvimento de Produto.

Em sinergia entre a experiência académica e empresarial, a Doutora Amoroso alcançou elevados resultados na sua carreira profissional, liderando atividades de I&D, desenvolvimento de produtos, desenvolvimento estratégico, e análise de mercado num vasto leque de empresas. Implementou as melhores práticas de mercado em setores que vão da Banca e Finanças, ao PropTech, Consultoria e Investigação, e Startups Inovadoras.

A extensa produção científica de Alex Amoroso inclui numerosos artigos publicados em revistas conceituadas, bem como apresentações orais e posters em conferências internacionais. Os resultados da sua investigação têm sido apresentados em instituições de renome como a Faculdade de Ciências Políticas e Sociais e a Stressed Out Conference na UCL, entre outras.

Com uma paixão pela colaboração interdisciplinar e um compromisso em impulsionar mudanças positivas, Alex Amoroso dedica-se a capacitar alunos e profissionais para a utilização de metodologias de vanguarda para alcançar a excelência no mundo empresarial global.


Objetivos do Curso:

● Dotar-vos de conhecimentos e competências para uma eficaz tomada de decisão

● Enfatizar a inovação centrada no ser humano e o conhecimento executável

● Abordagem multidisciplinar para a inovação e desenvolvimento de produtos


O que são Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos?

As metodologias de investigação em estratégia e desenvolvimento de produtos são as abordagens e ferramentas estruturadas utilizadas para recolher, analisar e interpretar informação que apoia planos estratégicos e a criação de produtos. Garantem que as decisões estão enraizadas em provas e nas necessidades dos clientes, e não em suposições.


Principais Focos das Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos

● Estudo de Mercado: Compreender a dimensão, tendências, concorrência e oportunidades dentro de um mercado ou indústria específica.

● Investigação de Clientes: Investigar as necessidades, pontos problemáticos, comportamentos e preferências do seu público-alvo.

● Análise da Concorrência: Avaliar os pontos fortes, fracos, estratégias e quota de mercado dos concorrentes.

● Análise de Tendências: Identificar padrões emergentes, tecnologias, ou preferências dos clientes que possam moldar o futuro.

● Análise Interna: Analisar os pontos fortes, fraquezas, capacidades e recursos de uma empresa para informar a estratégia.

● Teste de Conceito de Produto: Recolher feedback sobre ideias de produtos propostas numa fase inicial do processo de desenvolvimento.

● Teste de Usabilidade: Avaliar se um produto é fácil e intuitivo de usar.
targetAudiences: Sem requisitos especiais. Um curso para qualquer pessoa que queira construir uma carreira em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos

courseDetails.title: Professional Certificate in Coaching
courseDetails.shortDescription: Professional Certificate in Coaching by MTF Institute
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to course: Professional Certificate in Coaching by MTF Institute

! Important. Video lessons of that course are the same with our other coaching courses.

Difference in the pack of textual materials.


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 208 countries and has been chosen by more than 400 000 students.


You will know about: what is coaching, its types, components, rules; skills and competencies of coaches, how to proceed a coaching session and coaching methods and tools. After finishing a course you will get: key knowledge about coaching and how to implement it in effective ways


The Crucial Role of Coaching Techniques in Managerial Leadership and Career Development

The role of a manager goes far beyond traditional tasks of overseeing operations and ensuring productivity. A successful manager is now expected to act as a leader, a mentor, and a coach, guiding their team members towards individual and collective success. This paradigm shift highlights the significance of coaching techniques in the realm of managerial responsibilities.


The Transformation of Managerial Roles

Evolving Leadership Expectations

The traditional image of a manager as a stern authority figure has given way to a more holistic view of leadership. Managers are now expected to serve as role models, motivators, and mentors to their teams. This shift stems from the recognition that employees perform at their best when they feel valued, supported, and empowered.

The evolution of leadership expectations can be traced back to the changing dynamics of the modern workplace. In the past, managers were primarily responsible for enforcing rules and ensuring productivity. However, as organizations began to realize that employee engagement and satisfaction were crucial for success, a transformation in managerial roles ensued.

Today, managers are not just tasked with overseeing tasks and projects; they are expected to inspire and empower their teams. This shift is partly a response to the changing nature of work itself. In a knowledge-based economy, where creativity, innovation, and adaptability are paramount, traditional top-down management no longer suffices.


Coaching as a Leadership Skill

Coaching has emerged as a pivotal leadership skill that fosters personal and professional growth. We'll explore how coaching techniques, such as active listening, constructive feedback, and goal-setting, can empower managers to become effective leaders who inspire and guide their teams towards excellence.

Coaching is not a one-size-fits-all approach; it is a dynamic and personalized method of leadership. Effective coaches adapt their style to the needs and preferences of individual team members. They actively listen to understand the unique challenges and aspirations of each employee, fostering a sense of trust and rapport.

Moreover, coaching is not merely about providing solutions but guiding employees to discover answers themselves. This approach instills a sense of ownership and accountability in team members. It encourages them to take the initiative, think critically, and develop problem-solving skills—a valuable asset in today's fast-paced, ever-changing business landscape.

Coaching also plays a crucial role in setting and achieving goals. Effective managers use coaching techniques to collaboratively define clear, actionable objectives with their team members. This process not only aligns individual efforts with organizational goals but also empowers employees to track their progress and make necessary adjustments along the way.


Coaching Knowledge for Career Development

Career Development in the Modern Workplace

Career development is a top priority for employees. Discover how coaching knowledge equips managers with the tools to help team members navigate their career paths, set meaningful goals, and continually improve their skills.

Career development has evolved from being a peripheral concern to a central focus in the modern workplace. In an era marked by rapid technological advancements and industry disruptions, employees recognize the importance of continuous learning and skill enhancement to remain relevant and competitive.

This heightened emphasis on career development places managers at the forefront of helping their team members chart their professional journeys. Coaching knowledge equips managers with the ability to provide guidance that is not only aligned with the organization's needs but also tailored to the aspirations of individual employees.

One of the key advantages of coaching in career development is its ability to facilitate self-awareness. Effective coaches help employees identify their strengths, weaknesses, interests, and values. Armed with this self-knowledge, employees can make informed career decisions that align with their passions and long-term goals.


The Manager as a Career Development Partner

Explore the responsibilities of middle and top managers in preparing and mentoring personal development plans for their team members. Learn how these plans can align with organizational objectives and create a win-win situation for both employees and the company.

Managers who actively engage in career development become indispensable partners in their employees' professional growth. They play a pivotal role in creating personalized development plans that leverage individual strengths and address areas needing improvement.

These development plans not only benefit the employees but also the organization. By aligning individual development goals with the company's strategic objectives, managers ensure that every team member's growth contributes to the overall success of the business.

Furthermore, coaching techniques are instrumental in fostering a growth mindset within teams. Managers can use coaching to encourage employees to embrace challenges, persist in the face of setbacks, and view failures as opportunities for learning and improvement. This mindset shift has a profound impact on team performance and innovation.


Coaching for Internal Education and Employee Development

The Role of Managers in Internal Education

Managers often bear the responsibility of nurturing a culture of learning within their teams and organizations. Explore how coaching methods can be instrumental in identifying and addressing skill gaps, fostering innovation, and supporting ongoing employee development.

Organizations that prioritize learning and development gain a competitive edge. Managers are at the forefront of this initiative, serving as the catalysts for continuous improvement and innovation within their teams.

Coaching methods play a pivotal role in identifying and addressing skill gaps. By regularly assessing the competencies of their team members, managers can tailor training and development programs to bridge these gaps effectively. This proactive approach not only enhances individual skills but also bolsters the organization's overall capabilities.

Moreover, coaching encourages a culture of innovation. Effective coaches inspire creativity and critical thinking in their teams. They challenge employees to question the status quo, explore new ideas, and experiment with novel approaches. In this way, managers act as innovation champions, driving progress and adaptability.


Coaching as a Tool for Employee Empowerment

Employee empowerment is a cornerstone of effective leadership. Coaching techniques provide managers with the tools to empower their team members by fostering a sense of ownership and autonomy in their roles.

One of the primary ways coaching empowers employees is by promoting self-directed learning. Instead of relying solely on formal training programs, employees learn to identify their development needs and take initiative in seeking resources and opportunities for growth. Managers who coach effectively encourage this proactive approach.

Furthermore, coaching cultivates a growth-oriented mindset among employees. When team members receive regular feedback, both positive and constructive, they become more receptive to continuous improvement. They view challenges as opportunities for growth and development, which ultimately leads to higher levels of engagement and performance.

By creating an environment where continuous learning is celebrated, managers inspire their teams to thrive in an ever-changing business landscape. This culture of learning becomes a strategic advantage for organizations, as it enables them to adapt quickly to new challenges and opportunities.


Coaching for Mental Health and Well-being

The Manager as a Trusted Support System

For many employees, especially those who live alone or lack a strong support network, a manager can become their most trusted confidant. Understand how coaching methods extend beyond professional development to support the mental health and well-being of team members.

The relationship between a manager and their team members extends beyond the confines of the workplace. In some cases, a manager may be the primary source of support for an employee, especially when they are facing personal challenges or seeking guidance related to their mental health and well-being.

Coaching methods are not limited to career development; they encompass the whole spectrum of an employee's life. Effective managers create an environment where team members feel comfortable discussing personal challenges and seeking guidance when needed. This trust and openness are essential for maintaining employee well-being.

In situations where employees are dealing with stress, anxiety, or other mental health issues, managers with coaching skills can provide valuable support. They can listen empathetically, offer guidance on stress management techniques, and help employees access appropriate resources for professional help when necessary.


Coaching for Life Questions and Personal Challenges

Life is filled with complexities, and employees often grapple with personal challenges that can affect their work performance and overall well-being. Managers who are skilled in coaching can offer valuable guidance during these times of need.

One area where coaching is particularly beneficial is work-life balance. In today's fast-paced world, employees often struggle to juggle their professional and personal responsibilities. Managers can use coaching techniques to help team members set boundaries, manage their time effectively, and achieve a healthier work-life balance.

Coaching also proves invaluable in navigating interpersonal relationships, both within and outside the workplace. Managers can offer insights into effective communication, conflict resolution, and building positive relationships, which can significantly impact an employee's overall quality of life.

In times of personal crisis or uncertainty, such as major life transitions or unexpected challenges, employees may turn to their managers for guidance. Managers trained in coaching can provide a supportive and non-judgmental space for employees to explore their feelings, identify potential solutions, and develop action plans to address these challenges.


In conclusion, coaching techniques have become indispensable in the modern workplace, particularly within the roles of managers and leaders. These skills not only drive career development and internal education but also play a crucial role in supporting the mental health and well-being of employees.

As we navigate an ever-changing professional landscape, organizations that recognize the importance of coaching will not only foster a culture of continuous improvement but also cultivate a loyal and motivated workforce. Managers who embrace coaching as a core aspect of their leadership style will not only elevate their own careers but also become catalysts for the success of their teams and organizations as a whole.

By understanding and implementing coaching techniques effectively, managers can truly transform the workplace into an environment where individuals thrive, careers flourish, and holistic well-being is nurtured.

Design Thinking 3.0 - The #1 BEST-SELLING Design Thinking Course! (with over 800 ratings)


>> COURSE REGULARLY UPDATED (Last updated:   MARCH 2025): NEW TIPS, MORE LESSONS <<

>> CERTIFIED COACH, SPEAKER, AND TRAINER <<

>> OVER 346,000 STUDENTS IN TOTAL <<


Design thinking is the most understudied concept as it has actually been around for a very long time but it has never really been explored to its huge potential for the betterment of the business or organization. Organizations like Apple and Google use the concept of design thinking in their day-to-day customer interface and thus have been able to design full-proof products that only have one outcome “Success”.

In the past, design has most often occurred fairly far downstream in the development process and has focused on making new products aesthetically attractive or enhancing brand perception through smart, evocative advertising. Today, as innovation’s terrain expands to encompass human-centered processes and services as well as products, companies are asking designers to create ideas rather than simply dress them up.


Everything around you has been designed in an attempt to delight you. As customers when you are delighted with the product and you are eager to buy it, it doesn’t matter how expensive it is and thus companies/businesses which is capable of producing such products become the customers FAVORITE. 


In this course, you will learn the complete design thinking process and its various components. I have discussed each and every part of the process in detail and with examples and stories to make your understanding concrete. It’s my BOLD promise that the tools and techniques that I have discussed in this course can transform your business and have the potential to give you a huge breakthrough in your professional life.

courseDetails.title: Polars for Data Engineering  - DataFrame For The New Era
courseDetails.shortDescription: Polars, Lazy Frames,  DataFrames,  Parallel Processing, Files, Database, Data Structures, Databases, Query Plan, ETL
courseDetails.longDescription:
DataFrames For The New Era


Polars is written from the ground up with performance in mind. Its multi-threaded query engine is written in Rust and designed for effective parallelism. Its vectorized and columnar processing enables cache-coherent algorithms and high performance on modern processors.

You will feel right at home with Polars if you are familiar with data wrangling. Its expressions are intuitive and empower you to write code which is readable and performant at the same time.

Polars is and always will be open source. Driven by an active community of developers, everyone is encouraged to add new features and contribute. Polars is free to use under the MIT license.

The course is about performing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) using Polars in Python. The course convers the basics of Polars, Data Structures in Polars such as Series, DataFrames, .., Expressions such as Select Functionality, Operators , Renaming the Columns/ Fields and Handling Nulls. Working with the Transformations such as Filter, Sort, Join, Pivot, Concatenate, Melts and Windowing Functions. 


Polars supports reading and writing to all common data formats. This allows you to easily integrate Polars with your existing data stack.

  • Text: CSV & JSON

  • Binary: Parquet, Delta Lake, AVRO & Excel

  • IPC: Feather, Arrow

  • Databases: MySQL, Postgres, SQL Server, Sqlite, Redshift & Oracle

  • Cloud storage: S3, Azure Blob & Azure File

Course Author:

Stanisław Marek Halkiewicz

I am a seasoned educator specializing in the domains of econometrics, statistics, statistical programming, and mathematics, boasting an extensive track record exceeding three years. Notably, I have imparted my expertise to students hailing from prestigious global universities, solidifying my standing as a sought-after tutor. I have made significant contributions in research endeavors spanning statistics, econometrics, and statistical programming. Furthermore, my professional trajectory encompasses a diverse spectrum, ranging from project management to business intelligence and Data Science.


Course Description:

Introduction to Python Development is a course designed to introduce individuals to the world of Python programming. Python has gained immense popularity in recent years for its simplicity, versatility, and readability. This course is ideal for beginners who are new to programming.


Importance For Companies:

Versatility: Python is versatile and can be used for a wide range of applications, from web development and data analysis to artificial intelligence and automation. Companies can benefit from having Python developers who can adapt to various projects.


Productivity: Python's clean and readable syntax allows developers to write code more quickly and efficiently. This results in faster project development and reduced costs for companies.


Large Ecosystem: Python has a vast ecosystem of libraries and frameworks, making it easier for companies to find solutions to their specific needs. This reduces the need for reinventing the wheel.


Data Analysis and AI: Python is a go-to language for data analysis and machine learning. Companies can leverage Python to extract valuable insights from data and build AI-driven applications.


Community and Support: Python has a strong and active community of developers. Companies can tap into this community for support, resources, and talent recruitment.


Importance For Developers:


Career Opportunities: Learning Python opens up a wide range of career opportunities in various industries. Python developers are in high demand, and their skills are transferable to different domains.


Diversity of Roles: Python developers can work in roles such as web developer, data analyst, data scientist, machine learning engineer, and more. This diversity allows developers to explore different areas of interest.


Ease of Learning: Python's straightforward syntax makes it an ideal choice for beginners in programming. It's also accessible to experienced developers looking to add another language to their skill set.


Continuous Growth: Python is constantly evolving, with new libraries and frameworks being developed. This means that developers who invest in Python education can continue to grow their skill set over time.


Remote Work Opportunities: Python development often allows for remote work, providing developers with flexibility in their careers.


The course "Introduction to Python Development" provides a foundation for individuals looking to embark on a career in programming or expand their skill set. Python's significance in the tech industry, its versatility, and its demand in the job market make it a valuable asset for both companies and developers aiming to excel in today's technology-driven world.
